item.title: 23andMe says 15% of customers asked to delete their genetic data since bankruptcy
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: More than two dozen states have sued 23andMe to block the sale of genetic data without customers' permission.

item.title: Pinterest tests an AI feature that lets advertisers turn their catalogs into shoppable collages
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Pinterests is experimenting with "auto-collages," an AI feature that allows advertisers to quickly turn their product catalogs into shoppable collages.

item.title: The Browser Company launches its AI-first browser, Dia, in beta
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: With its built-in AI interface, Dia hopes to give people an easy way to use AI, cutting out the need to visit tools like ChatGPT, Perplexity, and Claude.

item.title: Uptime Industries wants to boost localized AI usage with an ‘AI-in-a-box’ called Lemony AI
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: The Lemony AI device can run large language models, AI agents and automated workflows locally.

item.title: Standard Nuclear emerges from the ashes of a failed startup
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Standard Nuclear was the winning bidder for Ultra Safe Nuclear Corporation's fuel-related assets at a bankruptcy auction.

item.title: Sam Altman thinks AI will have ‘novel insights’ next year
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: In a new essay published Tuesday called “The Gentle Singularity,” OpenAI CEO Sam Altman shared his latest vision for how AI will change the human experience over the next 15 years. The essay is a classic example of Altman’s futurism: hyping up the promise of AGI — and arguing that his company is quite close […]

item.title: Proxima Fusion joins the club of well-funded nuclear contenders with €130M Series A
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Commercial nuclear fusion power isn’t a reality yet. But venture capital is flowing into startups that promise that clean, safe, and virtually limitless energy is no longer just a distant dream. Most fusion companies that have raised over $100 million are based in the United States. Not Proxima Fusion, a German startup that has just […]

item.title: OpenAI’s open model is delayed
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: OpenAI was targeting an early summer release date for its open model, which is slated to have similar "reasoning" capabilities to OpenAI's o-series of models.

item.title: Vijay Pande, founding partner of a16z bio and health strategy, steps down
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Since its founding in 2014, a16z Bio+ Health has raised four funds of nearly $3 billion each, including a $1.5 billion fund that closed in 2022.

item.title: AI storage platform Vast Data aimed for $25B valuation in new round, sources say
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The AI-friendly data storage startup is raising capital at a giant leap in valuation.

item.title: Apple Intelligence: Everything you need to know about Apple’s AI model and services
item.dc:creator: Brian Heater, Amanda Silberling
item.description: Apple Intelligence was designed to leverage things that generative AI already does well, like text and image generation, to improve upon existing features.

item.title: YouTube says its ecosystem created 490K jobs and added $55B to the US GDP in 2024
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: YouTube's impact report shows that the creator economy has continued to grow, despite less interest from venture capitalists.

item.title: OpenAI releases o3-pro, a souped-up version of its o3 AI reasoning model
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: OpenAI has launched o3-pro, an AI model that the company claims is its most capable yet.

item.title: Bedrock Ocean dredges up $25M to map the seafloor with robots
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Bedrock Ocean wants to use autonomous underwater vehicles to make mapping the seafloor faster and cheaper.

item.title: Whole Foods warns of shortages after cyberattack at its primary distributor UNFI
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: The retail giant described the food shortages as "temporary supply challenges" following the cyberattack at its primary distributor, UNFI.

item.title: Why VCs should care about TechCrunch All Stage 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Let’s be honest: Most events aren’t built for VCs — they’re built around VCs. Panels, keynotes, maybe a few startups worth watching, and a sea of business cards you’ll forget by dinner. TechCrunch All Stage 2025 flips that script, when we fill up Boston’s SoWa Power Station on July 15. This isn’t just a chance […]

item.title: Love it or hate it? Apple’s new ‘Liquid Glass’ design is getting mixed reviews
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Some users and designers are already panning Apple's new user interface dubbed Liquid Glass, even though it's a bit early. There are reasons to think it might improve — but also valid critiques.

item.title: Atlassian rival Linear raises $82M at $1.25B valuation
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Linear, an enterprise software maker that competes with many of Atlassian's products, announced that it raised $82 million in a Series C funding round led by Accel.

item.title: Google rolls out Android 16 to Pixel phones, unveils AI-powered edit suggestion for Google Photos
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Google is releasing Android 16 to Pixel phones and rolling out additional updates to other Pixel devices.

item.title: What makes TechCrunch All Stage different from other startup events? Answers to your most pressing questions
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Tech and startup events have a formula. You know it. We know it. We’ve all done it. But TechCrunch All Stage 2025, which we’re hosting July 15 at the SoWa Power Station in Boston, is designed to break out of that rinse-and-repeat model — and focus on what early-stage startups actually need to know, right […]
